text:
28
NAEB RADIO NETWORK
PROGRAM OFFERING PROGRAM OFFERING
Title: POLITICS IN THE 20TH CENTURY
Type: Panel
Time: 29:30
No,: 8 programs
Origin: Community Education Project,
San Bernardino Valley College
(Grant-in-Aid)
Audience: General
Serial Number: 57-8
Release Date: January 6, 1957
This series seeks to survey the political scene in America since the turn of the
century, with particular notice of the immediate past and current political
questions.
Each program contains an analysis of the political scene by Samuel Lubell, news
analyst, followed by a discussion of Mr. Lubell*s remarks by a sociologist and
two political scientists.
Issue
1 REVOLT OF THE MODERATES - bringing back a
two-party politics,
2 ELLIS ISLAND TO CAPITOL HILL - the hyphenated
American, the immigrant.
3 POLITICS OF REVENGE - isolationism.
4 NEGRO ON THE MOVE - conflicts on the race
question.
5 WHITHER DIXIE? - the conservative revolution
in the South: unity versus separatism.
6 DIVIDED WE PLOW - battle for the farm vote.
7 WHAT NEXT FOR THE UNIONS? - growth of labor
as a political force.
8 WAITING GAME - cold war versus domestic
politics.
Program
